title: Nobody can believe it as West Ham's London Stadium is shortlisted for Stadium of the Year
text:
Sport Nobody can believe it as West Ham's London Stadium is shortlisted for Stadium of the Year West Ham's move to their new home hasn't been short of incident, but that hasn't stopped the London Stadium being recognised among the very best   
Forget about ticketing issues, stewarding problems and complaints about the atmosphere, the London Stadium is among the best new grounds in the world according to the experts. 
West Ham's Stratford home has reached the final stage of the Stadium of the Year competition, and is now named among the top 10 new arenas on the globe. 
A panel of top architects will judge the winner next week, with the Hammers' home shortlisted for the 2016 award along with the likes of the Besiktas's Vodafone Arena in Istanbul, Udinese's Dacia Arena and the Hard Rock Stadium, the home of the Miami Dolphins. One of the top 10 new stadiums in the world, apparently (Photo: Clive Rose) Andy Carroll's overhead against Crystal Palace last month is already commemorated at the ground (Photo: Arfa Griffiths) 
But given all the issues surrounding the club's move to their new home, West Ham's rather proud announcement of their nomination was met with some degree of shock. 
And then when the club's vice-chairman Karren Brady later tweeted about it, you could have guessed what the reaction was going to be like... 
Still, at least that's one accolade that the Hammers can win this season, eh? Like us on Facebook
